website_summaries.verdict: Not the best at standing up to the elements but extremely easy to set up, which makes it ideal for festivals or camping in the summer.
pros: Pop-up design simple enough for novice campers
cons: Harder to fold back into the bag than to set up

customer_reviews.title: Pop up Backyard Camping
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 11 year old daughter's birthday. She loves it and uses it indoors and out. With both doors on either side and windows on the end, ventilation is a breeze. Folding it was a bit tricky, but I figured it out after watching a YouTube video (hint: after you fold it into a taco standing on its end, fold the top down into the middle of itself (like folding into 3rds) not folding into the middle). We wouldn't use this tent in the rain, but for hanging out in the backyard, it is great!
customer_reviews.author: K. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Falling apart after 4 uses
customer_reviews.text: This tent is convenient and well designed but the fabric is falling apart leaving small holes all over (see pictures). I contacted the manufacturer. They said that was not normal but I wasn't happy with their resolution.
customer_reviews.author: ★ School Living Club

customer_reviews.title: We love it
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to setup and packup back. We love this tent!
customer_reviews.author: Lana Rudkovsky

customer_reviews.title: Loving it so far
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. My son uses it out back to read and play games in. Its rained a little and still held up well with no leaks. Good tent for the money!
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Urban Camping
customer_reviews.text: Tent is AMAZING!!!!!! I used it for 'urban camping' - (read crashing in someones living room) and it's perfect!! Zippers work, design is beautiful and it's huge! You will easily fit even is you'e like 6'. It's HUGE from the inside. Would have loved this as a kid for a 'fort'. Pretty durable too!
customer_reviews.author: Eng120300

customer_reviews.title: Best portable bed for visiting 2 year old.
customer_reviews.text: This tent is high quality , easy to put up and put away. We actually used it to house each of our two grandkids while they were visting 6 and 3 1/2.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie W. Yount

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love it! it’s even bigger on the inside than it looks. fits two people comfortably. (adults.) It could possibly fit three people if you’re all sitting up and not laying down. or two adults and one small child. came packaged well. great purchase!!
customer_reviews.author: Cierra Reneè

customer_reviews.title: Withstands normal beach winds.
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent!!! Perfect for our beach vacay! We have a 5 month old and I was able to breast feed in it while our other 4 kiddos played. We put all our snacks/drink bags and back packs in it. It helped to ensure it wouldn’t fly away during nap time for the baby. It has stakes, but with the sand I didn’t trust only stakes in the sand. It was pretty windy and didn’t go anywhere. Love this tent! Buying another one for soccer games in the sun or rain.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 5

customer_reviews.title: I really like this tent it is so big and pops right ...
customer_reviews.text: I really like this tent it is so big and pops right up but it did have a hole on the strap that holds the poles together when we took it out of the package I worry that it will get bigger fast because of the constant pulling that is on that strap.
customer_reviews.author: squeeg22

customer_reviews.title: Received Obviously Used Product
customer_reviews.text: Portion of the case detached from the zipper. No instructions. WORSE: tent is USED. It has whitish athletic shoe footprints all over one end and underside, which is also sandy. One thing is for sure, it is not the new tent I paid for, or fit for the use I intended.
customer_reviews.author: VeeGee

customer_reviews.title: Got this for a homeless man
customer_reviews.text: I saw this online and thought this would be perfect for a homeless man that lives near an abandoned building in our neighborhood. We have been getting a lot of rain lately - and I wanted to get him something that would be easy to “pack and go”. My boyfriend opened it (to check for tips) & he said it opened very easily and basically unfolded itself into place. But he did say he, alone, had issues when he was trying to put it back in its bag. Said it would be easier with 2 people. Hoping this helps the man and keeps him warmer and safer in this weather.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda 📚

customer_reviews.title: It already ripped & my kids are so sad!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this tent to my kids as a gift. It popped right open & they immediately started playing in it. In less than 48 hours, the fabric on the bottom that covers the plastic pieces started to tear. I’m not sure if it’ll continue to tear & become unusable. For now, it still works, but I’m disappointed. I’m hoping to hear back, but for now my review is a 3 based on the quick tear. :(
customer_reviews.author: NC537

customer_reviews.title: arrived broken
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. It arrived with a broken pole that was even sticking out of the bag. The bag itself- which really isn't that important- came ripped/scratched/scruffed on both sides. At first glance when opening the box, I thought it was a previous return- which I honestly would have been okay with. But broken... totally useless. I didn't even take it out of the bag.
customer_reviews.author: dudetteabides

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves this.
customer_reviews.text: We are a baseball family. My son plays travel ball. If you have other young kids who are forced with the torture of having to hang out at all weekend tournaments you need this. All the sisters love this. They laydown in this, play dolls. Watch their ipads. Can fit 2 full sleeping bags, and keeps them warmer during cold weather. You still need to be under shade during heat as it still gets hot but def protects from wind. Its so tricky to fold back together, still figuring that part out
customer_reviews.author: Luana’s Happy Home

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This tent is amazing, my daughter was so extremely happy when she saw me taking this rent out of the box , she played all day yesterday and when I woke up In the morning she wasn’t in her bed , I went downstairs and she was playing in her tent in living room 😀. I didn’t expect to be that big and it’s so easy to store because it gets very small . Very happy about my purchase, I bought this tent for my 4 years old daughter because she likes to pretend that she is camping
customer_reviews.author: Alexa

customer_reviews.title: Purchased, used once, then one of the support clasps/brackets broke.  $50 down the drain.  AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased two months ago, took on a first camping trip two weeks ago, and one of the brackets broke when I was packing it up. And I know for a fact that I was packing it right. This is a poor quality product. Avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Joudeh Ghazaleh

customer_reviews.title: For the price, I love it!!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, well I opened my tent, removed the elastic band. Explosion!! Make room for it if opening in house! But it’s so nice, cute, roomy and very nice for the price. Folding it back up was a challenge, but is manageable. Have no t used it outside and don’t intend to, but I feel it’s perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Carol C.

customer_reviews.title: Design is nice (would gladly buy if better quality)
customer_reviews.text: Design is nice (would gladly buy if better quality), materials and stitching - ...just OK. BUT poles - broke after second folding next day just im standing - too weak to hold the folded form or just defective. And I am sure it is not my failure - I use other brand folding cabana for 16 years(!) - every year, multiple times unfolding and folding each year! - and poles are still 100% fine!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Kunde

customer_reviews.title: from perfect to fair weather only
customer_reviews.text: In many aspects, this tent was exactly what I expected. Super easy to set up and tear down, although a little tricky to fold up and get back in the bag. The ad says it fits 2 people, but if you want to be comfortable it's really just a one person tent. Be very aware that this tent will not keep you dry if it rains during your camping trip. Having a tarp in the trees above the tent could solve this, but then that zeros out the ease of automatic pop up. If you are planning all your camping trips around excellent weather forecasts then it's an awesome little tent.
customer_reviews.author: Frank J. Cosentino

customer_reviews.title: Great concept, but disappointed in quality (tear and stains)
customer_reviews.text: Opened today. We were so excited to receive this product but unfortunately we are disappointed. Product popped up immediately as described. Product received has a spreading tear. It also has stains. Quality of material appears to be subpar if compared to cheaper non pop up tents found in retail stores. The side windows also open from the outside and are not 100 percent sealable if it rains. Giving it two stars only because it pops up quickly and is light weight. The Concept is good but not worth the money spent in my opinion. Also, At first try not able to un-pop (dissemble) but this probably takes a lot of practice so not grading on that aspect.
customer_reviews.author: Dee Customer

customer_reviews.title: Held up well in rainy weather
customer_reviews.text: Took this along with another tried-and-true tent to see how this would hold up and we were pleasantly surprised. It rained hard all night and there were only a few drops of water inside so I think an application of silicone and you'd be good to go. We used a plastic tarp underneath. It was also handy to use when claiming camping site spot upon arrival, set up in 2 mn. Stayed in perfect shape and did not budge through rough weather. Super easy to set up and fold when done. Inside is large enough for not-so-tall person. Two people would be crowded in this. Both sides have mesh screen so plenty of air flow.
customer_reviews.author: Frogster

customer_reviews.title: Nice Tent
customer_reviews.text: My kids love this tent. It is a fun time for them when they have friends over. They pack their snacks, get their pillows and blankets and make a night of it. I like that it doesnt have to be put together. Just pull it out of it's carrying case and pop it open. I let the kids do it themselves. it was very easy to set up. I would recommend this product to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: teri brooks

customer_reviews.title: This tent is impossible to close!
customer_reviews.text: The tent opens for immediate use. It is very pretty and very well made. It is also highly functional with good quality zippers and flaps. However, it did not come with closing instructions. After watching several YouTube videos a dozen times in which strapping young men showed me how to close the tent, I had a good idea how to do it and believe me, it was not intuitive. However, when my husband and I attempted it, you would think we were wrestling an anaconda! Through some miracle, we finally got it back in the sleeve. Returned. Good luck to you.
customer_reviews.author: joan

customer_reviews.title: So...lightweight and compact!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great...practice folding a few times before using...once you get it down...its reallt easy...i used it on the beach...was great
customer_reviews.author: Doug W

customer_reviews.title: Kinda small
customer_reviews.text: It is as advertised, except the 2-person part. At 6’1” this is a 3/4 of a person tent. The price is right for casual camping, but if you camp somewhere other than a fixed site with table/fire pit then I would get something more substantial. Great for backyard camping with the kids, easy to set up/break down. Perfect for day trips and light camping
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Tends to explode in your hands! Which is okay if your expecting it. Still trying to figure out how to control that (something inside that 'hoop' wants out real bad!). Not to difficult to fold up with a little practice. Follow the included illustrations. Its a little intuitive, so i can understand how some people might find it frustrating. This is not a serious camping tent (REI for that), but great for casual back yard stuff. I wouldn't trust it in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: GeoMac

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it!!!
customer_reviews.text: First off this tent is very flimsy and it tore before I ever used it! It got holes in it from the moment i opened it! VERY DIFFICULT TO FOLD BACK UP. It is NOT WORTH THE MONEY. And it fits ONLY 1 1/2 Adults or 2 small kids! As the ends curve in it DOES NOT allow you to stretch out fully. You cant put anything in the tent for storage as you just wont have room to lay down and sleep. I would say, DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY, it's worth buying a coleman and spending a few more bucks than wasting 50 on this. And it is NOT water proof or resistant either. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Suzzan G

customer_reviews.title: Seconds to put up
customer_reviews.text: Never heard of these types of tents until a few days ago when I saw it on Amazon and ordered it. I'm 5'10 and this 2 person tent fits me sitting down and laying flat. Fits maybe 3 adults sitting down or 2 adults laying down max. I can sit straight up and not hit the top unless I'm kneeling then I'll have to slouch. Could fit 3 kids and a dog in there. Taking it down and folding it back was tricky at first. Update: 8/16/2020 Using this at the beach right now and it feels like a sauna in here haha breathable though. I have the windows rolled up, but it's pretty warm-ish hot without a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: CANNOT GO WRONG Best tent I've ever bought for the value
customer_reviews.text: This tent is EXACTLY as described. Its applications are very diverse Its not just a beach tent, but it works just as well for light camping - It can be anchored to the ground despite being a pop up, and comes with the hardware for such. Two doors, Two windows, can comfortably sleep two adults and even enough room to play cards, each use a notebook. Can sleeep three kids up to 10 if needed. Very comfy for multiple applications. Good beach or spring/fall forest tent during light weather. Not made for inclement conditions or hardcore camping.
customer_reviews.author: Marcos

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I used my tent one time at general Butler state park in Kentucky. The next time I set it up I had a broken screen and would not zip. I think I was not given the value for the money I spent!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Panko

customer_reviews.title: So easy...
customer_reviews.text: a caveman wishes he had this tent. It pops open in a second! Fastest set up ever. If you arrive to your campsite late, no worries. I was unsure about how the folding would work but after watching a video on YouTube I figured it out quickly. It took me longer to put it into its zipper bag than it did for me to fold it up.
customer_reviews.author: Marko Pola Poppy

customer_reviews.title: Love it but cannot fold it.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my twin toddlers (yes I said for my toddlers)mainly to use indoors because every pop up kids tent I bought them they destroyed within a week or so. This is larger than expected but that’s not a bad thing. It’s light weight and they seem to love it. They sit in it and play with their blocks, baby dolls etc and at times they rough play in it. I plan on using it outdoors in the back yard when weather permits. My only complaint is I cannot fold it down properly no matter how many times I read or look at the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: netting quality could improve, But overall happy and would purchase again
customer_reviews.text: Small Holes in the netting where the net meets the zipper is pulling apart but more as a result of the way I am using it currently with my sons mattress inside. Otherwise the design, functionality and size is so great! But I had to take away 1 star cause it could be stronger. If it worsens I’ll probably buy again though cause If used for beach or camping I’m sure it would hold up well. We are excited to use at the beach this summer. I like that there is a full zip screen on each side as well as a full enclosed zip flap on each side.
customer_reviews.author: Brenna

customer_reviews.title: Easy Open
customer_reviews.text: Firstly, this tent is NOT for two people unless you like being squished together. So for one person sleeping on floor it's great. I bought a Coleman cot at Walmart ,(great cot), and it just fits inside. The nicest thing about this tent is it opens in a flash. Just stand back and let go. Folding it up, however, was a real challenge. I and 2 others had to watch YouTube videos several times before getting the hang of it. Still, I'm happy with the purchase. I didn't use it in the rain, so I can't comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Jeri Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the beginning camper
customer_reviews.text: No setup time at all! Just pop open and you’re done! Perfect for the first time adventurer. Only one though. Two would have to be some small people... the netting is also cheap and so the airflow is a bit stifled, but I’m nitpicking at this point. Folding it back up is a lot harder than unfolding, but that’s always the case. I thought it was a great concept that I was done setting up while the other campers were still threading their frames, etc.... Like I said it’s a beginner’s tent but I enjoyed it immensely
customer_reviews.author: Page-Flipper

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up and collapsing
customer_reviews.text: This tent was the easiest by far I ever owned to set up. I pulled it out the bag and it instantly popped up. It's definitely comfy for one, with plenty of venting options. I didn't have the instructions to collapse it, but I was able to figure it out. It wouldn't fit back in the included bag, however; but I was able to collapse it enough to transport it back home. For the price and features, highly recommended. I didn't try it with two people, but there's enough space for 2, if you don't mind some extra coziness.
customer_reviews.author: s-kaf

customer_reviews.title: No durability
customer_reviews.text: True disappointment. In less than a month from purchase, the black nylon that encases the poles has shredded to make the tent a) impossible to fold & b) unstable tent. In the 3 weeks we had the tent, it was great & is quick & easy to put up, reasonably easy to fold once you master it. Durability is HORRIBLE.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fabric Breakdown After One Use!  Do Not buy!
customer_reviews.text: Deployed tent for first use on regular dirt and grass during a cloudy and misty day. Once we got home, we let the tent dry out before folding it back up. Once we folded it back up, we noticed that several places at the bottom of the tent had started to break down. I give the tent one or two more uses before it will be worthless. Do not buy! Wish I could my money back or a replacement of better quality, but I doubt that will happen.
customer_reviews.author: FuSoYa

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to take with and pop up
customer_reviews.text: Love the room inside for 2 people, kept me warm on the beach at night while my husband was sharking. Not sure how water proof it is as yet because the tent on the inside got a little moist from the mist coming off the ocean. Havent tested it out in the rain yet. I got very frustrated in the beginning when i didnt know how to fold it up properly, but i watched a youtube video on someone folding her tent and i got it easily. Once you learn how to fold it, the tent will be a breeze to take with you anywhere and to pop it up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gear tent. It violently unfolds and sets up in a literal second. Forget getting it to fold back in the bag it comes in. You have to know some sort of sorcery like folding fitted sheets to get it that small again. It comes with instructions on how to do it but I don't believe them. So far I'm happy with my purchase. I'm going to use it for car camping, I would not take this on a hike though. Even fitted back in the original bag its a big flat circle and not useful to pack on your back.
customer_reviews.author: kevin

customer_reviews.title: It’s fine. Not what I ended up wanting.
customer_reviews.text: So I was hoping for an easy lightweight option to hike up with our students to our site. This is most definitely light weight... But it’s a little awkward in carrying especially if you have other items that are of a totally different size/type. There’s something very awkward about this flat circle trying to lug it along with backpack and sleeping bag and pad. I think it’s more of a stay at home play with the kids in the backyard or even in the living room type of pop-up tent
customer_reviews.author: EKM

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up. Well made.
customer_reviews.text: I love that it sets up instantly! You toss it on the ground & it pops up; just tack it down with the included stakes so that it won't blow away. Its so fun 😃. I bought it for visiting grandkids & read Edgar Allen Poe to them in the dark with all 3 kids, their pillows & blankets inside. They loved it!
customer_reviews.author: smiley

customer_reviews.title: ARrived broken
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with one of the poles snapped in half. I almost killed myself trying to get it back in the box with a broken pole.
customer_reviews.author: GeorgiaGirl

customer_reviews.title: Fun , Easy, Giggles !
customer_reviews.text: Such a fun activity. Fits 1 child/1 adult (or 2 kids) . Lots of giggles! We used rechargeable night lights instead of flashlights for a soft glow and invented stories. The tents opens so easily , in literally a few seconds, and we set it up in our living room and sometimes on the deck ... comfy, lots of ventilation, and a great adventure! In effect, it carves out an extra bedroom in the house!
customer_reviews.author: Glinda

customer_reviews.title: Just as described very easy to put up
customer_reviews.text: This tent pops up in an instant with out any effort. Folding it back up took looking up a video online, but after that it was easy. Our son loved sleeping in it in the back yard and we are taking it on our camping trip next week. Zippers glide easy and did not get caught - my only "complaint" is that the mesh on the doors could be better quality - everything was intact however a couple of spots the mesh was not as tight.
customer_reviews.author: JoB

customer_reviews.title: It is cool because setting it up is pretty much on step
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a scout camping trip. It is cool because setting it up is pretty much on step: take it out of the carrying bag. It pops open and comes with small stakes to secure it to the ground. My son and I fit in it, but he is an averaged size seven-year old. Two adults would be a tight fit, especially if you want to keep your backpacks and other supplies in there with you. It was almost as easy to pack up. I would recommend it for a single adult, or two medium-sized adults who don't mind being in close quarters.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the beach!
customer_reviews.text: It’s definite nice and convenient. I like is for the beach since assembling a tent with wind and sand was never fun for me. I wouldn’t take it on a camping trip though. I like when I can see the sky and dismount everything into a small bag to hike. Not a fan of the circle this folds into. I also like a lot of windows. But that’s just personal preference. I don’t regret my purchase at all.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia

customer_reviews.title: Pop-Up tent
customer_reviews.text: Have bought 5 of these and (obviously) like the quality and size. For kids these are great fun. Large adults may not like. I am 5'-10" and pretty much fit head-to-toe so anyone taller might have a problem I think. They pop-out in a flash but getting them folded-away is a bear! Grand kids have used these indoors and out and love them. Very light-weight so would recommend them only for GOOD weather conditions.
customer_reviews.author: T. Gould

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Efficient Bed Tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent was used on my kid’s twin bed so she could have privacy from her sibling. It offers a separate mesh covering to zip up the tent from bugs - BOTH left and right sides and a small mesh window in the front and back. The outer blue lining is available to maintain one’s privacy, so when my kid is in her tent, daddy and mommy have no idea if she is awake or asleep - she is able to sleep or watch videos in her own space.
customer_reviews.author: Cirrus

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent for my great grand kids and they love it, we are watching one of them full time right now as there is no school, he plays in it all day even sleeps in it at times, I don't really know how it would hold up camping as it is very light weight, it would depend on were the person was going, park or grassy camp ground would be fine bit really ruffing it maybe not, 2 people can fit in it easily or 3 small kids. I would recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: D. Verhoeven

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: All three of my grandchildren love to go camping and sleep in tents. Since they love it so much I keep three small tents at my place for when they come over to spend the night. Even though they are spending the night in the house I can set up all three tents in the family room and they can pretend they are camping. This one is by far the easiest one of the three tents to put up and take down and so far, It is holding up great. I would highly recommend this tent.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of room inside.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this since our old tent got broken last fall. We use this types of pop-up tents quite often, since all of our kids play outdoor soccer yearlong, and this is a must have if you have younger children who likes to roam around. With this tent, you can keep your youngsters inside of the tent with snacks and some toys. This one is pretty big for a pop-up tent and have a plenty of room. I think at least 4-5 kids can fit inside as long as they are sitting up. Very sturdy and well built.
customer_reviews.author: ako

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put up, hard to take down
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pop up tent. It is easy to put up. Make sure to keep your face back away when you are putting it up. It can pop up quickly and you might get slapped in the face, as we learned here. The difficult part is taking the tent down. We have never been able to get it down all of the way so that it is able to fit into the provided case. We are able to fold it down but it is still too big to fit in the case. Overall a great quick tent. We use ours for our kids to play in or backyard camping.
customer_reviews.author: Braxton

customer_reviews.title: Leaks at the seams
customer_reviews.text: Easy to pop open, hard to put back to original size. Fabric/stitchings/threads near seams absorbs water and leaks inside. Stay under very light rain long enough the seams will eventually get soaked and drip inside while larger surface area of fabric stays water proof/resistant.
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: Cheap materials
customer_reviews.text: Made out of very cheap material. Zipper broke after a few uses. Condensation built inside. And the mesh that’s supposed to keep bugs out is too big to keep ants. But if you’re just looking for something super cheap to use for an event or where durability doesn’t matter it does it’s job. Length didn’t fit a 6ft man comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Nishimura Lee

customer_reviews.title: Very portable!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this tent for my kids’ “fort” in the backyard woods, so we haven’t tested it with actual camping yet. However, it’s working perfectly for our purpose, especially its easy transport in and outside. The directions for folding it up weren’t super easy to follow, so I had to watch a YouTube video the first time I folded it up, but now I’m a pro at it. We haven’t had any of the zipper problems mentioned in other reviews that almost kept me from buying it. I’m very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: M Thompson

customer_reviews.title: We love our Fort!! ☺️😉
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my kiddos 7, 5, & 2 to play in at the ballpark with other players siblings. My oldest 11 plays travel baseball and I wanted something to occupy the littles, keep toys contained in and have my youngest nap in. It has been the BEST purchase!!!!!!! With long hours at the ballfield (every weekend from March to July/August) it definitely has served it's purpose. After about 1 year of use it's got some holes in the bottom, but with several young children, running in, out, wrestling, playing with toys, jumping, and everything kids do it's still in better shape than I thought it'd be.
customer_reviews.author: Momma of 4

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I loved how easy it was to set up this tent. Just opened the bag and let it out basically! It’s an awesome little tent. Me and my gf fit in together but there was only room for lying down on our sides. The windows allow breezes to come thru and on nice day- it’s awesome. I imagine it would be great at a beach too. But the only thing is if the sun is beaming down on it... ur gonna feel it.
customer_reviews.author: Ti'Ki

customer_reviews.title: Cheap product
customer_reviews.text: I liked this product was easy to setup out of the bag, but my dislikes outweighed my one like by far. The tent was leaking though the seams, and I kept on feeling rain droplets come through the window even though it was closed (it did not zip close, but was held close with a tie or something). I'm 5'10", it was a few inches too short for me, felt like a sardine. The part where you put the spikes completely broke off and could no longer be held down to the ground, this was especially crucial since it was windy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little tent
customer_reviews.text: Arrived quickly, set up was SO EASY, I was able to do it alone in under a minute. Bought for my 6" son (who fits comfortably) and his 3 year old for backyard camping. It is perfect for that. I am not sure how water resistant it is, and probably will not find out as this wasn't bought for that kind of camping. For what we intend to use it for it is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tent time with our sugar gliders. . . .
customer_reviews.text: This tent is perfect for the area of the living room that we use to have tent time with our sugar gliders. They love the mesh on all four sides, as do we since we can watch tv through it. It also has a couple of places on the edges at the top to hang things from for the gliders to play on. Easy to fold once you get the hang of it and very resilient. We have opened and folded this tent almost every day since receiving it. :D
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: First time Tent Owner
customer_reviews.text: I just got the tent for a christmas present for my son so when his grandmother comes they can have a tent use out side and play in. The tent is way bigger than i thought and roomy. My son is 6 years but we both sat in it together. I am 5'4 and thick. and he had plenty of room to stand up and move!!! great tent so far. I was just a little confused on how to close it watched a youtube video . and i got it. Quality great. Light weight and it is a pretty blue.
customer_reviews.author: dreamers

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tent
customer_reviews.text: This pop-up tent is much nicer than I was expecting. Usually when a tent says it sleeps 2 people, it means 1 1/2 people. But this tent really will accommodate 2 adults. A 5ft 5in adult can sit up without hitting the ceiling. I don't know about water proofing as yet. Tent is easy and fast to pop up and down. Good photo directions.
customer_reviews.author: H. G.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy for people who don’t camp often and just going for a short trip.
customer_reviews.text: I’m writing this review from inside my tent. This little thing is perfect!! I’m 5’1 and fit in here comfortably with a blow up twin mattress, backpack, and room to spare. Idk about 2 people. I experienced strong winds, rain, sunshine, and beautiful weather, and this tent took it all like a champ. I stayed warm and dry. Perfect for camping. Literally pops open and was so easy to fold up. I never give reviews, but for this tent, I had to!!! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Yeah that’s me

customer_reviews.title: Great indoor/outdoor tent
customer_reviews.text: We use this tent indoors and out. Very roomy and easy to fold back up once open. Usually pop up tents have a trick but once you get this one right the first time, it comes naturally.
customer_reviews.author: Desiry

customer_reviews.title: Good tent for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping. Excellent little tent for the money. My intention for this tent was day use and kids play in the backyard and for that it's perfect. One thing to note the mesh is not super fine and I don't expect it will do great in a down pour so if your not expecting high end $400 back packing tent you will be happy with it. Super easy to deploy but you will need practice to put it back into case. So far I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: aleks

customer_reviews.title: can NOT refold to use storage bag, instructions to do this are very unclear, tried for an hour
customer_reviews.text: love the tent, it's easy to use indoors and out for play for our young children, love the 2 doors with bug screen in addition to solid door on both sides, also 2 windows on each end of the tent, just CAN NOT refold for storage, tried several times, the written instructions are unclear, no video available to view for help
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Great tent once you learn how to close it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent - we use them indoors, so I can't speak to waterproofness. I love the size and how quickly I can set them up and take them down. They are kind of hard to learn how to close - I had to find a video on youtube (and I have to hold them tightly when replacing into their bags so they don't pop back open). But that notwithstanding they've been great and I'd buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: K. Briggs

customer_reviews.title: Kids love it
customer_reviews.text: This won't hold up in rain. It will leak. Beyond that, it is wonderful. My ten year old girls can set it up and after some practice can take it down by themselves too. This has been up days at a time in the house, in the yard, all over. I totally scored with the kids on this one! Love it. Three 10 year old girls have no issue spending the night in it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart within a few months
customer_reviews.text: It is much bigger than I imagined, when it is folded up, and fairly small when it is unfolded. The bag that it came it, when I opened it, the tent popped out and almost hit me in the face. I never figured out how to fold it back into the bag again. The fabric is very thin and flimsy. Within the first few uses, the black parts supporting the poles starting ripping apart. Overall, it is not sturdy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Eva

customer_reviews.title: never even opened it
customer_reviews.text: i read on the amazon description that this tent comes with a matching footprint - it does not - so i returned it right away. i cannot speak to its quality, but coming from marmot, i suspect it is top shelf. also seemed a bit heavy for my long backpacking trips through the mountains and deserts. i think i'll just stay with my big agnes copper spur 1, and upgrade to the two-person model sometime later. amazon was gracious enough to pay pay for postage back since it was not as described on their website.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Blank

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for babies first beach trip!
customer_reviews.text: Need something for the beach as we had a 2 y/o And a 12 week old baby in tow. Wanted something light/portable so they could get out of the sun and I could breastfeed with some privacy. This worked amazing! Folding took a minute or so but you figure it out. Love the windows on all four sides and both kids/me/dad and our stuff all fit. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sydney5291

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. Much resilience. Very complicated.
customer_reviews.text: Good tent just takes some getting used to getting it put away. Not waterproof so don’t count on that in the rain. Other than that pretty decent quality and lightweight. I wish it’d fold in another smaller circle but it doesn’t. It’s the size of your torso when it’s folded so it’s pretty huge.

customer_reviews.title: Simple set up. Slightly tricky to put away. Great price!
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought it for an indoor overnight. I wanted privacy where other people would be also staying overnight. Threw in an air mattress, slept great. It took up no more room than a cot. Simple 2secound set up. The trick is getting it back to the little pack able circle. Great price
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Marie

customer_reviews.title: You’ll never get it folder back in.  :(
customer_reviews.text: Couldn’t fold it up. I even hired a Task Rabbit. i couldn’t grt thrm until the return window closed and with 3 adults trying we couldn’t get this folded. I’m so sad that the return window just closed. If you order this try to fold it asap and return it so you can get your money back.
customer_reviews.author: Lavasca

customer_reviews.title: so far, so good!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent, but I haven't yet put it to the test outdoors. I'm also still having a hell of a time folding the thing up properly so it'll fit in the bag. There are YouTube videos to help, though, and once I nail steps 4-5, I should have it down. I bough this for solo camping since my Coleman is really too big & too much of a hassle for just me. I fit in it comfortably with gear. No idea about how it handles rain/moisture, yet. I'll report back when I get a chance to test it. So far, very happy!
customer_reviews.author: K.

customer_reviews.title: Quick set up
customer_reviews.text: One of the quickest ways to get a tent set up - just pops up. Love it! It took some figuring out at first how to close it down. Not too difficult once you figure it out but what help was watching some videos of people setting them up rather than try to figure out the enclosed directions. I have enjoyed it so much I bought a second one for when the grandkids come - and we sleep out on the porch weather permitting.
customer_reviews.author: A. N. Green

customer_reviews.title: Great lil tent
customer_reviews.text: Great backyard fun! I had to watch a youtube video to figure out how to fold it right. The direction are accurate but I just couldn't get it to work. Once I saw it...easy peasy! Great airy lil tent. We were rained on, put it on wet grass & we stayed dry. I am 5'5" and was able to lay dwn in the tent.
customer_reviews.author: Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy little tent gets lots of use.
customer_reviews.text: This pops up as expected and can be folded up and packed by one person. We use it on the beach. Perfect to get out of sun and take a nap. I duct taped a few strained seams so they’ll last. Ours sustains a ton of abuse by the kids, so it’s not due to any defect.
customer_reviews.author: Joellyn Jarvis

customer_reviews.title: Super easy tent to use!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic tent! Literally pops up in a second and less than a minute to take down (watched a video on YouTube and then once I got the hang of it -it was easy!!). Can not speak towards outdoor use since currently my daughter just uses it to camp out in her bedroom but she loves it! We also received it super fast - so seller is great too!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle M

customer_reviews.title: Adorable tent
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very nice tent and definitely pops up holes well in the weather and it’s just all around adorable. My daughter even uses it in the living room when she has movie night LOL. It is a little difficult like everyone else says to fold up but once you get the hang of it it’s a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy Pop up
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best pop up tent that you can get. The thickness is not the best, its package profile is big and it is sometimes not easy to pack it up but it is light and you get a tent in seconds. I don't think it will hold on windy days but it's good for it's intended purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Ryu

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing purchase
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing . Bought as a birthday gift for my daughter and the mesh part didn’t last for 24 hrs , with large rip that can’t be fixed . Unfortunately I had purchased mid June and just gave to my daughter yesterday for her birthday and at this point I can’t return it . Now I have a ripped tent and a upset child .
customer_reviews.author: Duca

customer_reviews.title: Good cheap tent
customer_reviews.text: After reading the reviews on how cheaply made this tent is I checked it immediately after unboxing. When you get in the tent it is easy to see the pins holes and some seam threads coming undone. This is just replacing the blanket fort we build with our 4 year old granddaughter. Very easy to bring out and put away and I am getting a good product for the amount of money I paid.
customer_reviews.author: Moore

customer_reviews.title: I only needed a tent for one night and this was perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Extremely affordable, lightweight and easy to use, I love this tent. Yes, it's not the highest quality so I would recommend using the zippers with care. But it assembled itself in 2 seconds and was a breeze to fold back up and put in its carrying case (watch videos on this beforehand and you'll be a master in no time.)
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: No rain but completely dew-soaked
customer_reviews.text: My daughter used this tent once and despite there being no rain during her overnight trip, the dew completely soaked through and most everything she had was waterlogged. I tried contacting the company, but they never responded to my email. Find something a little more reputable and keep your hard earned money in your wallet.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah

customer_reviews.title: Very Hard to Fold back!!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for our 8year old son to play around when he is outside. Nice size, easy pop up but it is a pain to fold back. I was only able to fold it back once the right way after so many YouTube tutorial. Now I do not want to mesh with it anymore and it is still up in my child’s playroom since I could NOT fold it back the right way again and I’m fed up with it!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Bolton

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for kids!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is great for a little needed shelter. I bought it so my 10-year old daughter could be sheltered from the elements while watching her brother’s baseball games. It can get hot inside on sunny days without wind, so make sure to keep the window flaps open. It pops up easily, and we figured out how to close it by watching a video online. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Online Shopping Mom

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Easy
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for my 7 year old daughter's birthday because she wanted an inside tent that was easy to put away. It's a great tent, pops up easy and is a perfect size. Folding it down is a little tricky until you get the hang of it. We watched a video and followed the exact instructions. I love that I can fold it up super quick when not in use. We have not used it outside, but we have used it many times indoors and it is holding up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: missy

customer_reviews.title: Roomy Quality Pop Up Tent.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this roomy quality pop up tent for my grandkids and they love it so much. It goes everywhere with them. Imagination and Naturistic enjoyed to the fullest. Pay attention to the closing instructions. A video one is also provided on this website.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Unhappy Camper
customer_reviews.text: I am just now getting around to using the tent, and when I do use it I discover that there is a hole in the screen and it has never been used. Was not a happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little tent!
customer_reviews.text: We have not used the tent outside, we bought it more for living room camping, but so far it's great! Fits two kids inside comfortably and packs away nicely. I did have to watch a YouTube video to figure out how to close it, but now it's a cinch.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: This tent has a silver lining. LOL
customer_reviews.text: This tent has a silver lining. LOL. but for real. Tent appears very wind & weather proof with a silver lining interior that when all doors and windows are zipped closed doesn't let air in and seams to hold body heat in. Great small tent for camping during spring and fall weather. I can't comment on winter weather use. I will add to my review when we test in the Texas summer heat.
customer_reviews.author: Leann Word

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Want to take time out of putting up a tent? This is the way to go. A little confusing on how to put away but their are many YouTube videos with great instructions on how.
customer_reviews.author: jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Stand Back!
customer_reviews.text: This tent was so fun to show off on our recent trip! Everyone (Grandpa & Grandma) was impressed with the set up and how spacious it was. Taking it down was tricky, but we quickly found a YouTube to help figure it out. It's a great tent!
customer_reviews.author: GChat

customer_reviews.title: Super cool pop up tent.
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cool pop up tent. We got this as a gift for my daughters so they can use as a fort instead of them using bed sheets. It's very spacious. Very easy to set up. Just take it out of the bag and it snaps up itself. Just be careful it opens up very abruptly. The only thing a little hard with this is the folding it back up. It takes some getting used to and can be a little hard. There are paper instructions on how to fold and put away but I just youtubed it instead and it was much more helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Marcela Romero

customer_reviews.title: Not easy to fold back up but good tent
customer_reviews.text: I gave this only 3 stars because it comes with instructions on how to fold back up but they are not easy to follow. I had to watch a you tube tutorial and after 45 mins finally got it to go back in bag. Overall quality is good it is light weight and not too big. Will be using this at the beach for my toddler so for the purpose i will struggle with putting it away.
customer_reviews.author: A.Rearley

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent ⛺️
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent. Currently we are using it inside for sleeping our for 5 year old grandson. He loves it. If you have difficulty folding it back in the bag. Go to YouTube put in the name it’s much easier after you watch someone else instead of reading the directions.
customer_reviews.author: n/a

customer_reviews.title: Camp Tent and Beach Tent
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and took me a minute to close but very easy once I got the hang of it. It is not good to have in the rain because it will get wet underneath and you will need to move immediately. Good quality tent and very cute. I like the little screen window that it has but the flap was a bit hard to keep open. It has two loops inside to hang things such as a lamp. I camped in this and I was very warm in the tent with my sleeping bag. It was cozy would definitely recommend:)
customer_reviews.author: Amira

customer_reviews.title: super easy
customer_reviews.text: so easy to use. bought this for my parents cause they like to go camping. they said it's snug for 2 people but fits perfect. when they first opened it they were suprised how quickly it popped open but we had a good laugh. really makes pitching a tent and packing it a breeze. definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: sodance

product_meta.title: Pop Up Tent - Automatic Instant Tent - Portable Cabana Beach Tent - Fits 2 People - Windows and Doors on Both Sides - Water Resistant, UV Protection Sun Shelter - Carry Bag Included
feature_bullets: EFFORTLESS CAMPING – Pops open into a read-to-use form (auto-setup) in a blink & proves easy to fold into a compact form – Abco Pop up tent is ideal for casual camping and accommodates 1-2 persons. Like a beautiful spot enroute? Setup your tent instantly!

DOUBLE DOORS – With double doors on both left and right side, it’s easy to step out from either side. Moreover, a combination of inner zippered screen plus outer zippered nylon layer give an ability to easily switch between high breathability and complete privacy.

HIGH BREATHABILITY – Two mesh windows on the front and back add further to the air circulation while the solid nylon flaps over the windows allow for privacy. Not only breathability, you can just open everything and enjoy the surroundings too.

CARRY BAG & ACCESSORIES – Comes with a carry bag that's ideal for storage and carrying it along, and in addition, a small bag for accessories to keep them organized – occupies little space in your car trunk or even when stored at home.

GUARANTEE – With our 100% RISK-FREE SATISFACTION GUARANTEE you have got nothing to lose. However, we are quite sure that you will be super impressed with this smart tent that doesn't require complex set up, gets ready to use in a blink, and remains easy to carry along.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
